Registration Open Until February 1 to Receive Landscape Pesticide Advance Notices

MADISON -- Homeowners and renters have until February 1, 2024 to sign up for 2024 growing season notices through the Wisconsin Department of Agriculture, Trade and Consumer Protection's (DATCP) landscape pesticide registry. Registrants receive advance notice from commercial lawn care companies that apply pesticides to lawns, trees, and shrubs to nearby property. You can submit addresses that you want to receive notification for that are located on your block or on adjacent blocks. There is no cost to register, and you must re-register every year.

To register, use either of the following methods:

-   Online: Visit <https://mydatcp.wi.gov> and click on "Registries/Lists" and select "Landscape Registry."

-   Paper: Download, fill out, and mail a paper form available at <https://datcp.wi.gov/Pages/Programs_Services/LandPestReg.aspx>.

The landscape pesticide registry will start March 15, when pesticide applicators are required to notify individuals at least 12 hours in advance when registered addresses are to be treated with pesticides ("pesticide" is a broad term that can include herbicides, fungicides, and insecticides). The registry applies only to commercial landscape applications. The registry does not apply to the following:

-   Homeowners or landlords who do their own pesticide applications

-   Pesticide applications to the inside or outside of buildings; including around a workplace, school, or day care center

-   Pesticide use in agriculture

To learn more about the landscape pesticide registry, visit <https://datcp.wi.gov/Pages/Programs_Services/LandPestReg.aspx>.

The registry is a service offered by DATCP. For the 2023 growing season, over 4,500 addresses were registered to receive notice.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

**How to register multiple addresses**

The website is not efficient for entering multiple addresses, as each house must be selected one at a time. To sign up for every house available for you, download the paper form as a Word Document, fill it out, and email it to datcplandscaperegistry\@wi.gov. You can use the following list of addresses to get you started. They should cover most of the neighborhood. Paste the list on the second page of the form (don't worry about putting it in their table).

**Tip:** As the calls come in from the pesticide companies, save their contact information in your phone so you know who is calling. Do not answer the calls so they will be forced to leave a voice mail.
